intro: Zanthoxylum duckei, commonly known as the Vietnamese prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with potential medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects. Zanthoxylum duckei thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
